definition: to begin a lecture/to start on a story

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture

sentences.english: Let's begin we class dawn an English song.
sentences.chinese: 咱们以一首英语歌开讲。

sentences.english: The whole of the club turnedinstinctively, waiting to hear what the old man had tosay;
sentences.chinese: 全俱乐部的人都本能地转过脸，等着听这位老者开讲。

sentences.english: "You can't leave off till you have gone on, " said Dick.
sentences.chinese: “你不能在没有开讲之前就停下来呀，”狄克说到。

sentences.english: Look into the eyes of the audience, then speak.
sentences.chinese: 看着观众的目光，然后开讲。

sentences.english: Aren’t you glad we told you about the sushi first?
sentences.chinese: 我们把寿司的话题提前开讲难道你不高兴吗？

definition: to give a lecture/to lecture on
school begins/give a course/teach a subject
to attend a lecture/to listen to a talk
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
tutorial/period of tuition for one or two students
